fields.description:
Am trying to add an attachment using the addAttachment remote API in python script, and my code looks something like this..

server.confluence1.addAttachment(token,pageId ,attachment,attachmentData)

where pageId = long(2283) where 2283 is an existing page id,
            attachment is a Hash type with the required values in it.
           attachmentData = xmlrpclib.Binary(buffer) , buffer got from a file.

other APIs like storepage, login etc are working fine, only this is giving an exception saying 
Fault: <Fault 0: 'java.lang.NoSuchMethodException: $Proxy38.addAttachment(java.lang.String, int, java.util.Hashtable, [B)'>


I am not able to figure out where the problem is. Can somebody pleas help me with this??

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5058].
  {panel}

A series of hyphens is not rendered into em-dash or en-dash if it is not surrounded by spaces.

I think that this is incorrect, because typographically, em-dashes should not be surrounded by spaces (see Wikipedia citation below).

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dash#En_dash

I am coming to Confluence from experience with Textile under drupal/PHP. In that environment, Textile does not require surrounding spaces.
fields.summary: em and en dashes should not need surrounding whitespace.

fields.description:
My catalina.out logfile is not almost 300M big after running for about 2 months.  It is filled with log entries like the following:

Nov 10, 2005 10:12:00 AM org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader findResourceInternal
INFO: Illegal access: this web application instance has been stopped already.  Could not load bucket/event/jobs/TaskQueueFlushJob.properties.  The eventual following stack trace is caused by an error thrown for debugging purposes as well as to attempt to terminate the thread which caused the illegal access, and has no functional impact.
Nov 10, 2005 10:12:00 AM org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader findResourceInternal
INFO: Illegal access: this web application instance has been stopped already.  Could not load bucket/event/jobs/TaskQueueFlushJob.properties.  The eventual following stack trace is caused by an error thrown for debugging purposes as well as to attempt to terminate the thread which caused the illegal access, and has no functional impact.
Nov 10, 2005 10:12:15 AM org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader findResourceInternal
INFO: Illegal access: this web application instance has been stopped already.  Could not load com/atlassian/confluence/event/jobs/ReferralQueueFlushJob.properties.  The eventual following stack trace is caused by an error thrown for debugging purposes as well as to attempt to terminate the thread which caused the illegal access, and has no functional impact.
Nov 10, 2005 10:12:15 AM org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader findResourceInternal
INFO: Illegal access: this web application instance has been stopped already.  Could not load com/atlassian/confluence/event/jobs/ReferralQueueFlushJob.properties.  The eventual following stack trace is caused by an error thrown for debugging purposes as well as to attempt to terminate the thread which caused the illegal access, and has no functional impact.
Nov 10, 2005 10:12:15 AM org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader findResourceInternal
INFO: Illegal access: this web application instance has been stopped already.  Could not load com/atlassian/confluence/event/jobs/ReferralQueueFlushJob.properties.  The eventual following stack trace is caused by an error thrown for debugging purposes as well as to attempt to terminate the thread which caused the illegal access, and has no functional impact.

I searched for 'findResourceInternal' and 'QueueFlushJob.properties' on the Atlassian support page and jira pages, but could find nothing.

Since catalina.out is difficult to rotate, and the Tomcat docs seem to say "you shouldn't put stuff there ... use a logging lib that rotates instead of sending things to stdout", I'm feeling a bit stuck.  I don't want to have to log in a couple of times a year to stop/start Tomcat and manually delete this file.

I was surprised to not find anything on the Atlassian site about catalina.out -- am I the only person having an issue with this file growing huge?
fields.summary: CLONE -Errors in catalina.out every 15 seconds about load error for TaskQueueFlushJob.properties

fields.description:
Currently a user has to watch/unwatch content on their own - there is no way (through the interface as a content editor, or programmatically through the API) to find out who is watching a page and be able to subscribe / unsubscribe users forcefully - at least as not as far as I know.

This sort of functionality would be nice, if not in the UI - then at least in the API (which possiblty already pre-exists) so it can be accessed & modified.
fields.summary: Add the ability to view & manage watchers of content

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5031].
  {panel}

It would be very nice to be able to use the RSS Feed Builder to become more of a general Notification Feed Builder - which would define the content of the feed (abstracting it from the output mechanism). This would enable the addition of various outputs, the following 3 I think are most desirable:

1. RSS XML (already existing)
2. HTML - The above, when viewed in a browser, should look similar to search results (or possibly blog results showing multiple blogs)
3. Email Notification - Through "watching" the feed - linked from the feed main page, and from the html above.

This would allow the user to choose how s/he gets their notifications as everyone has their own preference, and far more people have an email reader than an rss reader.
fields.summary: Add the ability to watch an RSS Feed Builder feed (and have the RSS XSLed like Search Results / Blog Results)

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce

* Upload an attachment to Confluence
* Download the attachment using its direct non-version-numbered link
* Upload a new version of the attachment
* Download the attachment using its direct non-version-numbered link

Expected: The new version of the attachment is downloaded
Actual: The browser returns the old version from its own cache

Clearing the Firefox cache fixes the problem.

Presumably, there's something wrong with the way we're doing Etag or If-Modified-Since, or we're erroneously setting an Expires: header (or whatever the HTTP equivalent is).
fields.summary: Firefox/IE retrieve cached version of attachments

  {panel}

Deleting large numbers of comments is Really Really Annoying.

Above the comments display, alongside the hide link, add a bulk delete link. Clicking this link redisplays the page, but gives each comment a "delete" checkbox. When the checkbox is ticked, the comment changes colour to show it's been selected.

At the bottom of the page, there's a big delete button that removes all highlighted comments at the same time.

if comments are mass-deleted  only a single email should be sent, summarising the deleted comments.

fields.description:
It would be ideal to detect when someone leaves the page (perhaps by accident) and have Confluence save the latest draft at the time the user leaves the page. 

Remapped short cut keys are one great example of why this is useful. Example of how somone would accidentally go Back in their browser on OS X in Firefox: Apple-Left goes to the start of the line in MS Word & even in JIRA, but when editing in Confluence it commands the browser to go back to the previous page.

This is a major step forwards in making Confluence the 'source of truth' in an organisation.

fields.description:
I have been wanting a macro for font size since the first time I used Confluence, but being a relative beginner I didn't want to post an issue about it if it had already been addressed.  Today I stumbled across this exchange: http://confluence.atlassian.com/spaces/viewthread.action?key=DOC&id=147729 which leads me to believe that it may not have come up in the past.

The headers macro is helpful for organizing documents via text size, but the headers include additional formatting changes as well (background color, horizontal line, etc.).  Though I have no trouble with it, a frequent user complaint that I hear from users (especially those in the over-50 set, who are already difficult to engage in a new technology) is that the font is too small.  A simple font size macro that would give users some flexibility who be great.  

Apologies in advance is this is ground already tread...
fields.summary: Macro for font size

fields.description:
When external user management is delegated to Jira, simple operations such as showing or hiding children or comments of a page trigger the following exception:

com.opensymphony.module.propertyset.PropertyException: JiraJdbcPropertySet is read only

I have external user management turned ON, (I even tried to turn it off and back on), no change, I wiped the entire Confluence install and started from scratch, generating a brand new example site, nothing seems to work.

It appears that even if external user management is enabled, Confluence tries to persist certain properties back to the OSUser  database, thus failing miserably when management is delegated to Jira.

I finally decompiled the "WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/confluence/user/providers/jira/JiraJdbcPropertySet.class file, changed two methods and recompiled it, and now it seems to be working fine: those are the changes I made:

    public void remove(String key) throws PropertyException {
        /* Commenting out the following will prevent Confluence crashes */
        //throw new PropertyException("JiraJdbcPropertySet is read only");
    }

    protected void setImpl(int type, String key, Object value) throws PropertyException {
        /* Commenting out the following will prevent Confluence crashes */
        //throw new PropertyException("JiraJdbcPropertySet is read only");
    }

fields.description:
The macros are currently not aware of other macros and do not have any reference to any other macros on the page. 

So, there is no way to get outer "container" or inner "container" from the "execute()" method of a class inherited from com.atlassian.renderer.v2.macro.BaseMacro.

In the outer macro, it would be nice to get the inner macro references. For example, a new Confluence API class can be useful to generate a table of contents after getting the list of block names relative to the inner macros. On the other hand, in the inner macro, it would be nice to get the outer macro reference.

Here is an wiki code example from customized macros :

  {imodule:title=Presentation}
  {iblock:title=Introduction}
  bla bla bla
  {iblock}
  {iblock:title=Part I}
  bla bla bla
  {iblock}
  {iblock:title=Part II}
  bla bla bla
  {iblock}
  {imodule}

And here is the relative "RAW" rendering :

  Presentation

  Table of contents :
    - Introduction
    - Part I
    - Part II

  a) Introduction
  bla bla bla
  b) Part I
  bla bla bla
  c) Part II
  bla bla bla

So, please vote for this feature request ! ;-)
fields.summary: New API to get references of outer / inner macros

fields.description:
From python's xmlrpclib, I send new page content to Confluence. xmlrpclib explicitly checks if the encoding is UTF-8 and if so, skips emitting the encoding in the prolog XML declaration.

In a storePage method, I post some UTF-8 encoded text. For example, 0xA0 (non-breaking space) is encoded in UTF-8 as 0xC2 0xA0. I have confirmed that these are the bytes on the wire. The OK response from the server has all UTF-8 characters changed to sequences of #65533 entities.

Glue's glue-config.xml has an <xmlEncodings> section near the bottom. Changing this to UTF-8 works around the problem. It's not clear to me that this section was ever doing the right thing for XML.
fields.summary: Glue corrupts UTF-8 in XML-RPC

fields.description: Using the SOAP API I exported a space using TYPE_HTML. I get back a zip file which has one entry, index.html, which is the space details only. I was expecting to get the same result as if I had exported the space manually - a zip file containing html files corresponding to each page.
fields.summary: export space returns zip file with Space Details only

fields.description:
Page title change is not recorded as page history

On changing a page's title, a new page version is recorded, however, when we later(several weeks or months later) diff the new version to its previous version, Confluence reports 0 changes. I hope Confluence can record page title change as well as show the change to user when doing page version compare, because sometimes we place valuable information in page title, e.g. we may write in title "some problem(unresolved)" then later change it to "some problem (resovled)". If title information is recorded, it will be beneficial to know when that problem is resolved by just checking its title change history.


See http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/diffpages.action?pageId=148866&originalId=148914 . I misspelled 'Atlassian' in the title of the page, Charles noticed this and made the correction. When I view his changes, however, I am told there are '0 changes'. The title of the page is not displayed in the diff region.
fields.summary: diffing of pages does not diff title

fields.description:

Perhaps this link could be moved to a more prominent location, e.g. next to the "Browse Space" link. Another option would be to change the behavior (or provide the option to change the behavior) of the "Browse Space" link so that this link always opens the page hierarchy, with the current page focussed.
